ExampleDefinition.Description:
As well as creating a Heatmap chart with SciChart 2D, you can also create one using the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.SciChart3DSurface.html']SciChart3DSurface[/url].
This is achieved by using a [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.RenderableSeries.SurfaceMeshRenderableSeries3D.html']SurfaceMeshRenderableSeries3D[/url] with [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Model.UniformGridDataSeries3D%603.html']UniformGridDataSeries3D[/url] and by using a [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.CameraController.html']CameraController[/url] with [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.CameraController~ProjectionMode.html']ProjectionMode[/url] = Orthogonal. The result is the camera looks top-down and can view the surface-mesh as a flat Heatmap.
[b][i]Tip![/i][/b]
The Heatmap can also be scrolled by pushing data to the the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Model.UniformGridDataSeries3D%603~PushRow.html']UniformGridDataSeries3D.PushRow[/url] method.
